channel.title: Posts on Westview Bridge Club
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Westview Bridge Club

item.title: Six and O!
item.description: A terrible day for Chris and Siddesh, who lost points every round. For the first 4 they had terrible hands, and for the last 2 hands they went down.

item.title: Scared by a Double
item.description: Our second community event at the Laurel Parc Senior Living Center. Dodged a grand slam bid today by saying too much.

item.title: First Community Event
item.description: This is our first Bridge community event overall and at the Avamere at Hillsboro Senior Living Center. We had a lot of fun interacting with the seniors there and playing Bridge together.

item.title: Snow Day Wednesday: The "Perfect Win Rate"
item.description: This was our best meet yet, we had enough people show up to play duplicate Bridge and everybody had a blast. After 2 back and forth rounds, the team Virinchi, Rehaan, Meet and Lohit ended up coming out on top.

item.title: First Duplicate Bridge
item.description: This was our best meet yet, we had enough people show up to play duplicate Bridge and everybody had a blast. After 2 back and forth rounds, the team Virinchi, Rehaan, Meet and Lohit ended up coming out on top.

item.title: Almost Duplicate Bridge
item.description: We had a great meeting, now with multiple people knowledgable people who know how to play Bridge, and a full 8 people at the end, but not enough time. If we have the full 8 people from the start next time, we can play duplicate bridge.

item.title: Bringing Generations Together Through Bridge
item.description: Laurel Parc Community Volunteering Event 2/5/2023: This is our first community volunteering event at Laurel Parc Senior Living Center. We met many expert players and learned a lot during this community event.

item.title: Finals Week
item.description: Chris was sick today, but we still had enough players to make a table of 4 and play for a bit. This week being finals week, a few of the other clubs like Chess club were cancelled so we also had Bhavin and Jerry check in earlier to play a few rounds of Bridge with us.

item.title: 1/9/2023 Meeting and First BBO Tournament
item.description: Great first meeting back from winter break! More new members, some solid practice rounds and First Bridge Base Online Tournaments.

item.title: Funbridge Deal Autocollection
item.description: This is a tutorial on how to use the funbridge autocollection bot to autocollect daily deals on Windows and Ubuntu Linux.

item.title: First Funbridge Tournament
item.description: Hello and welcome to our Bridge club! As a member of the club, I have to say that playing Bridge is an absolute blast. It’s a game that’s fun, challenging, and rewarding, and there’s always something new to learn and enjoy.

item.title: First Blog Post-12/12/2022 Meeting
item.description: Hello and welcome to our Bridge club! This is our first blog of a bridge club meeting.

item.title: How to Play Bridge
item.description: Getting Started This is a tutorial on how to get started playing bridge on a casual level. We recommend that you start by learning to play, then bidding, and finally if you are really up for it scoring. Scoring is complex and the rules for it change between different variants of bridge, so the best way to start out with scoring is to use a scoring cheatsheet, like this one from ACBL(American Contract Bridge League): https://web2.
